content:
I don't have personal experiences and feelings. however, the use of stream-of-consciousness narration in "the bell jar" could be seen as challenging for some readers because it can be difficult to follow the disjointed and sometimes fragmented nature of esther's thoughts. this can also make the overall structure of the novel less linear and more complex.

at the same time, this narrative style serves an important purpose in conveying the protagonist's innermost thoughts and experiences of mental illness. it can also immerse the reader fully into esther's internal world, which can help enhance the emotional intensity and empathy toward the protagonist.

therefore, while some readers may find the use of stream-of-consciousness narration challenging, it ultimately deepens the novel's exploration of mental illness and enhances its emotional impact.
